etymology.description: Depicts an eye 目(目) (mù, "eye") over a person 人(人) (rén, "person") -> representation of seeing or perception
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted an eye positioned over a person, symbolizing the act of seeing or encountering someone. This combination effectively conveys the idea of sight or meeting, aligning with its core meanings.
etymology.simplification: 見(見) (jiàn, "see") was simplified by reducing the number of strokes, using a simplified structure to retain both meaning and phonetic aspects effectively.

examples.chinese: 我见到老朋友时(我見到老朋友時)，心情十分愉快(心情十分愉快)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiàn dào lǎo péngyǒu shí, xīnqíng shífēn yúkuài.
examples.english: I felt very happy when I met my old friend.

examples.chinese: 我们见面了(我們見面了)。
在公园里见到一只小猫(在公園裡見到一隻小貓)，让我十分高兴(讓我十分高興)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gōngyuán lǐ jiàn dào yī zhī xiǎo māo, ràng wǒ shífēn gāoxìng.
examples.english: Seeing a little cat in the park made me very happy.
